name: Hotel Olivia Plaza

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: This has got to be the best value for the money in Barcelona! And what a GREAT location in Plaza Catalunya! Great food, service, location. It has its own charm and unique modern ambiance - very comfortable. It was a nice place to call home for a week. Neat outdoor eating area for breakfast and internet center available on second floor for those of us who don't like carrying laptops when we travel.
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel's central location is great to explore Barcelona on foot. And surprisingly quiet. We also enjoyed the space, layout and decor of our Superior-Room on the 5th floor. All the staff were very friendly. Although we did find reception's local knowledge was lacking. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect base to explore Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this hotel and it was a very central location. The Aerobus to and from the airport is just across the street and is only 5 Euros per person. And the Hop On, Hop off Bus is also right across the street. The rooms were nice and the beds were comfortable. The shower was very nice too! The hotel staff was always pleasant and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again!
reviews.title: Loved our stay at Hotel Olivia!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Situated on a sidestreet to the Ramblas, the hotel is right in the middle of the action without being right on the busy and arguably dodgy street. The metro is across the road and taxis and buses are right at your doorstep. Theres a Carefour express 5 mins away and shopping and food outlets all round. Arguably the best location in the city unless you want to be near the marina.
reviews.title: Brilliant location, cosy and funky

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009
reviews.text: The hotel and room decor is very modern, with basic ikea type furniture - functional but "cheap". Everything was spotless and in good condition. Rooms are a reasonable size with a small tv, free wifi and open-plan bathroom with little privacy. No pool or gym but there's also a lounge downstairs complete with big screen tv and a couple of PCs with internet for guests, which is a really nice touch. Get a room at the front for a great view of the square out front (although they can be noisy), as the rooms at the back have no view and you will have to keep the blinds closed since some of the windows face the lifts. You wont be sleeping early anyhow, the city is buzzing at midnight. Rooms dont have door latches so watch out for housekeeping bursting in at 8am despite your do not disturb signs. Walls are pretty thin and the a/c turns off if you take your key out of the power socket which is annoying (but the blinds go down automatically which is great).
reviews.title: Amazing location, creative design, very hip & stylish. Great food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Olivia Plaza for the last 2 nights of our 12 day vacation and wished we had another night there.
reviews.title: Perfect for our needs! Would stay here again for sure!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: As others have said, the location really can't be beat for tourists. You are steps away from La Rambla, the Hop On/Hop Off bus stop and shopping. It is a bit touristy as Hard Rock Cafe is next door, but there were tourists everywhere.
reviews.title: Small rooms but a perfect place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had excellent service from the front desk, the door men and the staff at breakfast. I must say the breakfast was quite impressive. By far the best we had for the entire trip and being able to sit outside in the quaint courtyard on a beautiful morning was wonderful.
reviews.title: Great location and service, but not ideal for business travel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room was quite nice. I liked the contemporary decor and the size. The bathroom is nice, if slightly different as the shower door slides open/closed for the shower and the toilet at the same time-as it is one door. The shower water does escape out into the toilet area a bit, but really not an issue-just different.
reviews.title: Location location location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we come back to Barcelona, we will stay here.
reviews.title: Great Location and Service
good hotel in plaza catalunyia
reviews.text: A very nice hotel right next to Hard Rock Cafe and La Rambla. Friendly staff, spacious clean rooms with good beds, and a very nice breakfastbuffet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only bad thing: A lot of "working girls" in the area at night.
reviews.title: No Iron, No Air con, Cold Breakfast...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010
reviews.text: Had it not been for a few silly niggles which could easily be resolved, this would be a great hotel. It's modern and very well located, however a few fundamental errors resulted in a tarnished stay.
reviews.title: If anything this Hotel is getting better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly there are no irons in the rooms. Upon questioning this with reception, the answer I was given was that it's because not many people know how to use them !
reviews.title: Beautiful but Expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: They went on to say that the only option was to use the hotels laundry service (£4 per shirt for ironing)
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: The best thing about Olivia Plaza is the location. Right in the middle of all the touristy spots, and right next to a metro station that can get you anywhere that isn't walking distance.
reviews.title: Mostly a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was big, clean and comfortable. I would say the walls could be thicker - I'm a light sleeper and was woken by other doors opening and closing and the people in the next room to me using the bathroom. The bed was comfortable but a bit on the hard side (this is a personal preference though). On the upside, the room had an electronic black-out curtain and a rainshower. The room is definitely designed for couples, or people travelling together who are very comfortable with each other - there is no separate bathroom as such (just a shower and toilet) and so you can see, via a mirror, anything that happens outside of the shower and toilet. As well, you can see the outline of the person in the shower from the bedroom.
reviews.title: wow wow wow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and helpful at all times.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Hotel in the Heart of Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: wow loved the place. Staff very nice, rooms sexy, location u cant beat this. Take aerobus from the airport drops u right outside the hotel. checkin leave ur bags get out and every thing is around you shopping eating bars name it. rooms very nice. Reception staff too good
reviews.title: Very modern - except the plumbing and electricity!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I have traveled to Barcelona in June with a friend, and we were looking for a more upscale hotel to spend our 8 days of vacation. We could not be appier with Plaza Olivia. The hotel interior itself is magnificent, everything seemed very new and crispy clean. A separate thank you to the staff, as they went an extra mile in offering suggestions for the restaraunts to go, places to visit and ways to get there. The hotel itself sits on top of the Plaza Catalunia metro station, and all the Barcelona attractions are 10-15 minutes away!
reviews.title: More than PERFECT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I opted to stay at the Olivia Plaza Hotel as I had a relatively good experience when I first stayed in the facility about 4 year ago. At that time, the hotel was still relatively new, hip and quite well regarded. The other "plus" point is the location - right in the Placa de Catalunya so it could not be more convenient to the main city attractions and places of interest including shopping etc.
reviews.title: Was much better the last time I stayed here ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sadly, the good and fond memories end here. The hotel now looks quite "dated", and seems to have lost a lot of its charm and "edge" when it first opened a few years ago.
reviews.title: Best location for Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms look exactly the same except that they look a lot more worn out with probably heavy utilisation. Wall paper was peeling off and you can see a lot of "patch-work" here and there. Flooring needs a lot of cleaning and change. There were cracks and chips in a number of areas around the walls etc. All in all, you can tell that this place needs a lot of major refurbishment.
reviews.title: Olivia Plaza made our Barcelona trip amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping was generally good and I sense that they are trying their best. The room walls are very thin so beware that you can hear your neighbours and they can probably hear you too!
reviews.title: Perfect location and good standing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: The air-conditioning does not work well too - it does not seem to be cool enough in the warm climate. Also, the Internet connection is VERY slow!
reviews.title: Wondefull

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a couple of nights when we were on our honeymoon. The location is great. The service is amazing (they upgraded us for free). Comfortable beds. Extremely clean. Amazing view. I highly recommend this one even though it was kinda pricey. However, if you want a quiet relaxing out of the city hotel, this one is not for you. We enjoyed it because we could walk to plaza de catalunya every night and we were looking for something in the city.
reviews.title: Lovely !
Perfecto
reviews.text: A great choice for a business stay in Barcelona. Nicely located in Plaza Cataluna, very close to the Ramblas. Rooms are modern, elegant and super clean..the bathroom is a jewel, try the jacuzzi bath, you will not regret it..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is one of the best I have ever stayed at in regards to the staff and service. The only reason the room got 4 stars vs. 5 was because there was no iron in the room.
reviews.title: Amazing Staff, Location and Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were incredibly warm and friendly upon checkin. They were eager to help with all of our needs and took their time with us.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel - great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was wonderful and the 13th Century Church wall was a great view every morning as we ate.
reviews.title: Some Good and Some Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was a beautiful hotel but not what we hoped it was. We stayed one night before leaving on a cruise. We had 2 rooms. One room w/ 3 adults and 1 room w/ 2 adults and teen. They first tried to give us a fold out --which we refused for the 3 adult room--we wanted 3 beds. Then they acted like it was our fault for not specifying 3 beds when we felt like the description of the room was misleading when we booked it. There is virtually no privacy when using the restroom or taking showers! Everything is glass. You cannot even get dressed in privacy. Very poorly laid out room. Lighting also very poor. For the expense you would expect at least a coffee maker! We thought are rooms came w/ breakfast based on the reviews but we did not get breakfast unless we wanted to pay 25E each! We also did not like the attitude of the staff. The only great thing about the hotel is the location. It is close to everything. We were glad that we did not book this hotel for the return night before departing.
reviews.title: not a good choice for families or friends--ok for couples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 6 days in this hotel and have a neutral feelings about it. It had a very good central location with clean rooms but was overpriced and lacked basic amenities for an extended stay like a fitness center, swimming pool, iron, laundry rooms and etc.
reviews.title: Good Location but overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Net net, I was not unhappy but would probably look at other options when return to Barcelona
reviews.title: Contemporary, Boutique Hotel in La Ramblas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Olivia Hotel is a small but impressive, contemporary, boutique hotel conveniently situated by La Ramblas. The metro is a 3 to 5 minute walk away. You are greeted by a pleasant and helpful hotel staff. My husband and my room was located on the fourth floor and had a fantastic view of the city and park area. The room itself was designed with contempory furnishings. I loved the color scheme was decorated in browns and grays and accented with contrasting colors of red and olive green. I loved the contemporary bathroom and vanity area. If you are the shy type or traveling with family, you may not appreciate the frosted shower glass partition that separates the actual shower from the sleeping area. I also appreciated that the room was very clean.
reviews.title: in the middle of the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I really like that Olivia Hotel was within walking distance or a metro away from most sites. I must take the time to walk to La Boqueria. My husband and I had breakfast there every morning. There is so much food to choose from it was a challenge trying to decide where we were going to eat. El Cortes market is also directly across the street from the Oliva Hotel. You can shop for food, clothing, souvenirs and miscellaneous necessities you may have forgotten at home all under one roof. For dinner, my husband and I had a variety of restaurants to choose from (again walking distance from the hotel).
reviews.title: WONDERFUL HOTEL, Great Staff, Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Except possibly the design. The rooms have an oddly industrial feel with 1 wall entirely finished in a deep red. There is no ornamentation whatever.
reviews.title: What's not to like?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the other hand the bed is very comfortable and the linens good,
reviews.title: Should have chosen another hotel
Great Hotel!!
reviews.text: The location is excellent with the airport bus stopping within yards and the hop on hop off outside the door .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Next door is a good coffee pastry and sandwich shop and they do excellent orange juice actually squeezed to order.
reviews.title: highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Breakfast in the hotel seemed expensive and the cold meats etc did not tempt me.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: This modern hotel is located in Plaza Catalunya, excellent location from which getting around and enjoy the whole city. After a brief misunderstood related with the reservation, that was quickly solved and in the best way, we had a wonderful stay with all the confort that a nice, big enough suite with a view to the Square can provide. We also have dinner in the hotel, which I highly recommend for its quality and service -which is not so frequent in Barcelona. At the hotel, it was impecable.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Olivia Plaza Hotel is a modern and stylish hotel, centrally located in Barcelona.
reviews.title: Olivia Plaza Hotel, Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It looks out onto Catalunya Square and is at the top end of Las Ramblas.
reviews.title: Great location you will love it.
Excellent location
reviews.text: The Hotel is in a great location within easy reach of all the main sight seeing attractions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for four nights and loved it. The hotel is clean, modern and the staff is so friendly, especially Rebecca. We had a room facing Placa de Catalunya with a balcony that was great. Turn right outside the hotel you are at La Rambles and you can pick up the hop on hop off bus and and the tour guide buses are right out front. You can walk to the Barcelona Cathedral, the Barri Gotic quarter, the Guell Palace and Placa Rieal. An added plus is a cafe right in front of the hotel, we could have cappuccino whenever we wanted! Don't bother to take a taxi from the airport the airport bus will drop you off right on the Catalunya Square for less then 6 euros.
reviews.title: Great Location! Great Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is perfect - on the Plaza Catalunya at the top of the Ramblas. All the buses - airport and tourist - stop here, and there are subway stops too.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is gorgeous - all modernist and yet comfortable. We paid a bit extra for an upgrade so that we would have a good view onto the plaza and also so that we had the enclosed bathroom which was great - big soaker tub, separate shower stall with rain shower - lovely!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel shame about the noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: There is a great coffee bar next door, and in the opposite direction a Hard Rock Cafe. Great eats at both, and at the Pizza Marzano at the top of the Ramblas.
reviews.title: Great Hotel,Great Location,Great city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff were great especially when my husband's wallet was stolen on the Ramblas. Leave your wallet in the hotel safe and take just the cash you can afford to lose.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location
Can't go wrong. Best hotel in the Best Location.
reviews.text: Other than the pickpocket, we had a great time in Barcelona!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't really add much to what already been said - great, modern rooms with a fantastic location at the end of Las Ramblas. Seriously just around the corner yet away from the noise. Staff weren't quite as friendly as others have said but I didn't ask for much either. Only word of warning (and why the room rating only got a 'good' ) is because our room had a big, fat, POST right in front of the sink/counter in the bathroom! Seriously, it was really in the way but I noticed from the floor plan that it is only one room on each floor (sorry, I can't remember our room # but make sure you specify you don't want that room!). Restaurant is lovely as well. No parking so you will be $30 Euros per day in the public park. We even tried driving a ways away to park but they are all the same price.
reviews.title: Seriously best location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed here for 5 nights in July. The location was absolutly perfect - right at the Placa de Cataloynia metro stop and only 2 block from Passie de Gracia metro stop. Its also right at the Aero bus stop which is super convineniet for getting to the airport. Its right of La Ramblas but not actually on La Ramblas so slightly quieter and I felt safer. There are tons of cute little streets to wander around just behind the hotel and absolutly no shortage of resturants/cafes to eat at. It was so relaxing being close to everything and well worth a little extra money. Even drinks at the bar were fairly reasonable - 4Euro for a glass of wine.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel, Fabulous Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff was also suuuper helpful and wonderful. Miguel in particular was so friendly and helpful to us we couldnt thank him more. My fiance did speak Spanish which helped, but they appreciated even my few words I knew that I was trying.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought the room was great, spacious, had a mini bar/fridge (that you could put your own things into), very clean, changed towels daily, big windows with great views - on both side of the hotel, we stayed at the back of the hotel and still had a great view. The bathroom situation is slightly weird but if you comfortable with the person your with no big deal. Also i discovered the last day there is a slide door in the bedroom that will cover the entire shower if you want to push it all the way back, if not its all frosted anyway.
reviews.title: Great location but rooms don’t offer a lot of privacy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would and probably will stay here again in a second.
reviews.title: One of my favourite hotels ever
Phenomenal View, Phenomenal Hotell
reviews.text: I spent three nights here earlier this month. The location can not be beat: it's a 45-second walk from the Aerobus stop. I was greeted warmly by Daniel a reception and given the key to my room on the seventh floor. The room turned out to be a three-part suite with a picture window over Placa Catalunya.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The amenities were fantastic: nice linens, great toiletries. The sofa in the sitting room was comfy though there was no reason to sit there when I was smack in the middle of town.
reviews.title: Home Away From Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was beyond friendly and I will absolutely try to stay here the next time I'm in Barcelona.
reviews.title: The Good and the Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location where you can reach everything very easily. Very friendly staff. Great General Manager! Spacious rooms. Excellent service. Very delicious breakfast. My family and I have enjoyed a very comfortable stay in the hotel while we were vacationing in Barcelona.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay
Nice hotel centrally located.
reviews.text: Faisal from Kuwait

description: Settled in the city's most central square, Playa Catalunya, each and every guest will have a unique vantage point for exploring the city during their stay at Olivia Plaza Hotel. This luxury Barcelona hotel is close to many attractions and historical sites, not to mention great shopping, dining, and nightlife. Enjoy spacious Barcelona accommodations, complete with state-of-the-art technology and modern amenities. For a truly vibrant and thrilling Barcelona vacation, book Olivia Plaza Hotel.
